intro: Pisum sativum var. polycarpum, commonly known as the polycarpic pea, is a botanical variant of the common pea. It is characterized by its ability to produce multiple crops throughout the growing season, making it a valuable crop for extended harvest periods. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. Its pods contain several seeds, which are similar in appearance to those of the common pea. This variety is often cultivated for its yield potential and adaptability to various growing conditions.
